TopicTitle: An incredible photo of the Atlas V launch this morning. (And other cool space-related photos?)

Articles.Content: Other photos of the launch in other parts of the location/world: http://www.dosado.photography/
Long exposure photography gets me every single time. In this case it was probably multiple exposures as opposed to on long one as the rest of the image is fairly dark
There was an Atlas V launch today? Darn. Did they stream it live?

They always do. Here's a highlight reel:

It was certainly one of the most visually impressive launches I've seen to date - it in fact caused

among Florida residents due to the highly visible upper atmosphere plume Edited September 3, 2015 by Streetwind

It was certainly one of the most visually impressive launches I've seen to date - it in fact caused
among Florida residents due to the highly visible upper atmosphere plume

Whoa, the plume looks impressive. No wonder why people thought it was a UFO. What is the explanation for that phenomenon? Shockwave + water vapour + early morning light?

On topic though, the picture in the OP makes me think of the tower of babel for some reason. We used to build towers of rocks and dirt in attempt of reaching the sky just for it to end in failure. But we never give up. Once again we build towers, this time out of raging fire and hardened metal, and with it we conquer the heavens, allowing us to go much further than ever before in history.

Edited September 3, 2015 by RainDreamer

What is the explanation for that phenomenon?

Rocket plume in vacuum lit by the sunlight. Enormous amount of morons are sharing the video where the plume is visible, claiming it's "aliens" or "god". So, so sad.

Less spectacular but not less interesting (hadn't ever seen anything like this): the rocket casting a shadow onto its own exhaust plume

From that same launch, obviously
I saw the launch replay, and this shadow is really amazing!

I saw the launch replay, and this shadow is really amazing!

I posted one of my pics on your launchers pack thread kart
